bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, January 31, 1942

div1.p: Ireland enjoyed Hench's Washington party at the Willard and tells Hench about a visit to Kean.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Philip Showalter Hench, January 31, 1942
div1.opener:
1870 Wyoming Ave.,
Washington, D.C.,
January 31, 1942
Doctor Philip S. Hench,
The Mayo Foundation,
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I have your letter of January 26th. I am
so sorry I did not know at the beginning that you were
going down to the archives. I could have made things
so easy for you. I am glad if I helped you along. When
you come the next time I hope I will not be a Whisper-
ing Bill so I can do something for you.

I had a nice visit with Kean last evening.
I showed him my letter and he showed me his letter from
you. We did enjoy our meeting with you at the Willard.
It was a wonderful crowd you had there and Mrs. Ireland
and I did enjoy so much becoming acquainted with Mrs.
Hench.
With kindest regards to both of you,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, M.W. Ireland Mr. Conner was the former
head of the Archives
